title: What is a Queue?
contentText: A queue is a linear data structure that follows First-In-First-Out (FIFO). The first inserted element is removed first.

title: Queue Structure and Operations
contentText: Enqueue inserts at the rear, and Dequeue removes from the front. Queue size can grow or shrink dynamically based on implementation.

title: Queue Use Cases
contentText: Queues are used in task scheduling, request processing, printer job handling, and message systems.

title: Advantages of Queue
contentText: Queue preserves processing order and is ideal for fair, ordered workflows and asynchronous processing.

title: Example Applications
contentText: Examples include customer service lines, CPU task queues, and event/message queue systems.
